intro: Leptorkis vestita, commonly known as the naked-leaved fern, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Leptorkis vestita thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
